availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund P. Watkins (Caldwell Co, Kentucky, circuit court clerk)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Mrs. J. Watkins. Married to Susan T. Osborn Watkins in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on December 31, 1847. Married to Paulina Gary Watkins c1858. Father of Lucy Watkins. Clerk in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk of the Caldwell Circuit Court in Princeton from 1858 to 1865. Owned six enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 8.

Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 305.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 11.
